title: TSMC Plans $165 Billion US Investment to Drive AI Technology
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) announces major expansion plans in the United States, with a planned investment of $165 billion to strengthen semiconductor manufacturing capabilities focused on artificial intelligence applications.
content:
Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker, has revealed ambitious plans to significantly expand its presence in the United States with a massive $165 billion investment initiative.

The investment will focus on building advanced semiconductor manufacturing facilities to meet growing demand for AI-related chips and strengthen the global semiconductor supply chain.

This strategic move represents one of the largest foreign investments in US manufacturing history and demonstrates TSMC's commitment to expanding its global footprint beyond Taiwan.

The company aims to develop cutting-edge fabrication plants that will produce advanced chips essential for artificial intelligence, machine learning, and high-performance computing applications.

source.title: TSMC Intends to Expand Its Investment in the United States to US$165 Billion to Power the Future of AI|Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited

markdown_content:
## Investment Announcement

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker, has revealed ambitious plans to significantly expand its presence in the United States with a massive $165 billion investment initiative.

The investment will focus on building advanced semiconductor manufacturing facilities to meet growing demand for AI-related chips and strengthen the global semiconductor supply chain.

## Strategic Impact

This strategic move represents one of the largest foreign investments in US manufacturing history and demonstrates TSMC's commitment to expanding its global footprint beyond Taiwan.

The company aims to develop cutting-edge fabrication plants that will produce advanced chips essential for:

* Artificial intelligence
* Machine learning
* High-performance computing applications
